pageContext.claim: “t has been suggested that we should rename as many as 10 of our Legendary Military Bases, such as Fort Bragg in North Carolina, Fort Hood in Texas, Fort Benning in Georgia, etc. These Monumental and very Powerful Bases have become part of a Great American Heritage, and a history of Winning, Victory, and Freedom.”
pageContext.analysis: These bases were named after confederate generals, who were certainly not winners. Braxton Bragg, for instance, was considered one of the worst general in the Civil War, rarely winning a battle and widely disliked by his troops.
